review_text: Gordon's beautiful home and property is a special place. It sits atop a hill and allows you to appreciate the stunning scenery while also lending full privacy. There is so much to see and explore on his land from the chickens to the koi pond to the greenhouse that you may not even feel the need to explore elsewhere. There's so many other spaces too - an outdoor kitchen and pergola, a swing and fire pit and a big red barn that has a small walking trail behind it. Despite the bitter cold, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves exploring all Gordon's property has to offer. And for those that want to get away but don't necessarily want to spend all day outside, there are numerous indoor games as well as table tennis. The kitchen is fully equipped for those that enjoy cooking and there is both a tea kettle and a coffee maker for a morning boost. We utilized two bedrooms in the home and the beds were quite comfortable and the sheets were of nice quality. I appreciate that there were plenty of toiletries left at the house as well (tp, soap, linens, etc). In addition to the home and property being lovely, the host, Gordon, was equally so. He was quick to respond and provided detailed driving instructions prior to our trip. He even made sure our 5 year old daughter "found" an egg in the chicken coop. It's this kindness and attention to detail that separates good hosts from incredible ones. If you're considering this beautiful property and home, book it. You'll be glad you did. We're already planning another trip in the spring so we can experience the property in a different season. Also, the location is great - it's 15 minutes to just about everything in the surrounding area.

We loved our stay at Gordon's place! We are already talking about coming back when the hot-tub is running and all of the plants are blooming.
The property is beautifully landscaped and the sunrise and sunset views are amazing from the top of the hill. Despite it being a very cold January weekend, we enjoyed sitting in the greenhouse during the day to play games. There are also a ton of stars visible on nights with few clouds.
The house itself is very well outfitted and the kitchen really does have everything you may need for cooking. The dining room table is big enough to squeeze in 10 people for meals and games.
Things I'd suggest to people looking at booking this house:
-Try to have at least one vehicle coming that has AWD. Front wheel drive cars will not make it up to the house, and carrying all your stuff up the hill is quite a cardio workout.
-If you want to hook a game system up to the TV, bring your own extension cord because there is not an accessible outlet near the TV.
-There are not many lights outside and it is very dark at night, so I'd suggest bringing headlamps or flashlights with you if you want to go outside at night.
-If you want to sleep in, bring an eye mask to block out the light because the bedrooms get very bright in the mornings.

As city folks coming to a country hilltop estate, it was a huge difference, but we had a great time! Gordon was very responsive and he had an amazing property.
Please please please, read and take snapshot of the details of how to get to the location. We arrived at night, which was not recommended because of the dark roads, but because of work and where we were coming from, that was the only time possible that we could make it. Your GPS will likely take you to the wrong spot, and we were trying to get into Gordon's neighbor's house (oops), until we called him.
Also, the service and wifi is a little iffy, so this is an amazing place for a getaway with your family. Being from Chicago, I rarely ever see chickens, so it was an amazing site when we woke up in the morning to see the chickens and even get a chance to get some fresh eggs.
Also, during the day, the property is beautiful! You must go out and explore! There's a small pond, bikes to explore the property and a cute greenhouse! The reason why I say during the day is just because it's super dark at night, so you can't see as much. That may be one of my only suggestions, if there could be a few more lights so that maybe people want to hang out on the property at night (i.e. hot tub, balcony/decks, pond, outdoor kitchen).
In addition, Gordon was very very responsive throughout both the day and night (even when I called him late at night because we were loss trying to get to the property).
Lastly, this location is a little further out from restaurants, etc. so just something to keep in mind. We visited for a baby shower in Spring Hill, which was about 40 minutes away. But there is a nice Mexican restaurant about 15 minutes away.
Would stay again, if I need another family get away.
